greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, read by rows, that transforms diagonals in the table of coefficients in the successive iterations of x+x^2 (cf. A122888).
link: Paul D. Hanna, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..495 (rows 0..30)
formula: Columns may be generated by a method illustrated by triangles A187005, A187115, and A187120. The main diagonal of triangles A187005, A187115, and A187120, equals columns 0, 1, and 2, respectively.
example: Coefficients in iterations of (x+x^2) form table A122888:
This triangle T transforms one diagonal in the above table into another;
start with the main diagonal of A122888, A112319, which begins:
then the transform T*A112319 equals A112317, which begins:
and the transform T*A112317 equals A112320, which begins:
program: (PARI) /* Generate by method given in A187005, A187115, A187120 (faster): */
xref: Cf. related sequences: A112319, A112317, A112320, A187009.
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Nov 18 2007
ext: Added cross-reference; example corrected and name changed by _Paul D. Hanna_, Feb 04 2011
